q: , 22:16 EST Google announced Thursday that co-founder Larry Page would replace Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the Internet giant in April. Google said Eric Schmidt would remain with the company as executive chairman and focus on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships. The firm's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , will work on strategic projects and new products, Google said in a statement. It said the management changes would take effect on April 4.

The first is the development of fast networks, specifically LTE, Eric Schmidt wrote. They will usher in new and creative applications, mostly entertainment and social, for these phone platforms, he wrote.
